website_summaries.verdict: For the majority of its users, the New Balance Fresh Foam Beacon delivered the perfect balance of cushion, lightness, and snappiness. Many were very impressed with its performance and thought there was little to none about the shoe that was worth criticizing. Overall, the Fresh Foam Beacon was a shoe that many considered as highly recommended to anyone looking for reliable running gear.
pros: The New Balance Fresh Foam Beacons is a comfortable running shoe, said some users
The shoe delivered a fantastic ride that was consistent throughout a marathon, commended a runner
According to some reviews, the Beacon provided plenty of cushioning that was perfect for long-distance pavement runs
Several users agreed that the Fresh Foam Beacon was a lightweight running shoe
The midsole provided adequate arch support, stated a runner
Another remarked that is was responsive and firm enough to supply speed
One customer wrote that the upper was flexible
A couple of runners admired the colors of the Fresh Foam Beacon
This running shoe has a reasonable price
cons: The sizing of the New Balance Beacon was too small, according to a few wearers
A few runners were disappointed because of the shoe's narrow forefoot
Some users are disappointed because the insole keeps on sliding around

customer_reviews.title: Very nice impact absorbtion but come up small and tight toe area
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in a size 8.5 but found these really tight in the toe area - probably a 9 would have been better, maybe even a 9.5 although 8.5 is generally perfect for me. The soles on these are very springy which I got for bad knees - its almost like running on marshmallows is the best way I can describe it, so if you like a firmer sole, these would not be suitable. I didn't feel these were built to last, they are very lightweight with a think fabric upper.
customer_reviews.author: A D

customer_reviews.title: Great daily trainer
customer_reviews.text: To get the Beacons 2 at this price was great. Fit as expected, used as a daily trainer for longer runs. Shoe feels stiff/hard until you run in them, then they feel just right. Able to handle tempo runs too.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. Humphreys

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer
customer_reviews.text: I Love Adidas ultra boost and I have struggled to find something as comfortable but these do it perfectly! There not as fast as ultra boost but are more comfortable and lighter and suit a wider foot so a perfect shoe for long training marathon miles The soles do like thorns but the heel is so thick I’ve not felt one yet .
customer_reviews.author: L. rathbone

customer_reviews.title: Light and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent comfort and a very nice light feel. Great value and so far no product complaints. I really like the heel fitting as it is very easy to slip on the shoe .
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN D BREMNER

customer_reviews.title: True to size
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe and great fit by New Balance. Really light and responsive on foot.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Really nice and light
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Beacon V2 since I had used the V1 and they fit me perfectly. I have a hard time finding shoes that fit my asymmatrically wide feet but the Beacon line fit really well. The shoes, to me, are shoes that can be used for different things. They handle long runs well and can also be used to pick up the pace. The have been my main daily running shoes and I really love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would be 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I love these shoes, they feel beautiful, super light and fits like a gem. They also look better than they do in the pictures, however the insoles of the shoe are not glued down so they can slide around a bit and require some readjusting every now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Deky

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: The soles are good, which is what I bought them for which is good... but no good if the top falls apart 100 miles in which is what happened to me

customer_reviews.title: but after that it has a great ride, with a good trade off between cushion ...
customer_reviews.text: It's necessary to break the shoe (15/20 km); but after that it has a great ride, with a good trade off between cushion and response. As someone says "it's a great Kinzante; a mix of Saucony Kinvara and New Balance Zante" :-)
customer_reviews.author: F OLIVEIRA PEDRO

customer_reviews.title: Superb neutral, lightweight, cushioned high mileage shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for 5-10 milers which is what I've done in them so far.....very comfortable, lightweight and excellent cushioning which means my calves are nowhere near as sore after a run. I expect these to be great for half or full marathons
customer_reviews.author: Jim Autton

customer_reviews.title: Moving soles
customer_reviews.text: The sole of the shoe is loose after about 6-7 times of wearing the shoe. Not good for a quality product. But fits well and is comfortable to jog in when the sole isn’t moving about.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great all round shoe
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely luv this shoe i have 19 pairs of shoes in my collection of various makes this beats the lot . What makes it so good is it's versatility short runs long runs and speed work and it's so comfortable that ive just ordered another pair. The only real complaint would be a slight lack of arch support but i would be nit picking .
customer_reviews.author: Keith Isaacs
